intro: Cistus × ralletii f. subcreticus, commonly known as the subcretic rockrose, is a hybrid shrub native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of fragrant, pale yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates with full sun exposure. It is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it contributes to the local biodiversity. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
